intro: Lastrea mingendensis, commonly known as the Mingendense Lastrea, is a rare and unique succulent native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its adaptations to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. Its leaves are typically reduced to spines, a characteristic common in many desert plants. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
